ProvaThe xUnit-Compatible AOT Runner

Migrate to Native AOT in minutes. No rewrites. No compromises.

Get Started
Why Prova?

1:1 xUnit Compatibility

Keep your [Fact], [Theory], and Assert.Equal. Prova speaks the language you already know.

Native AOT Ready

Zero reflection. Zero runtime discovery. Compiles to a static binary for instant startup.

Bounded Parallelism

Built-in SemaphoreSlim scheduler preventing CI crashes on low-resource containers.

Why developers choose Prova ​

csharp
// Zero changes needed. Just swap the runner.
[Fact]
public void Test_Calculator()
{
    var result = Calculator.Add(2, 2);
    Assert.Equal(4, result);
}
csharp
// This code crashes in AOT if using reflection-based runners
[Fact]
public void Test_Calculator()
{
    var result = Calculator.Add(2, 2);
    Assert.Equal(4, result);
}

The Architecture ​

Prova uses Source Generators to "unroll" your tests at compile time, bypassing the Reflection API entirely. This allows you to deploy AOT binaries with full test verification.
